title: Bhagavad Gita As It Is
description: The Bhagavad Gita is a 700-verse Hindu scripture that is part of the epic Mahabharata. This edition, 'As It Is', presents the original Sanskrit text with English translation and commentary by A. C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the founder of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness (ISKCON).
commentary: This sacred text presents a conversation between Prince Arjuna and Lord Krishna, who serves as his charioteer. It addresses the moral and philosophical dilemmas faced by Arjuna on the battlefield of Kurukshetra. The Gita covers topics such as dharma (duty), karma (action), yoga (spiritual practice), and moksha (liberation). Prabhupada's commentary provides deep insights into the spiritual teachings and their practical application in daily life.
